intro: Capsella elegans, commonly known as the elegant catchfly, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, featuring slender stems and small, white or pinkish flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, round, pinkish-brown seed pods. Capsella elegans is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in gardens or wildflower habitats.
